_meta.legalNote: Official Epic Games YouTube content only.

resources.title: Your First Hour in Unreal Engine 5
resources.description: Official Epic walkthrough of the UE5 editor interface, viewport navigation, content browser, and basic level editing. Perfect starting point for absolute beginners.
keyTakeaways: Navigate the 3D viewport using WASD + right-click mouse look
Use the Content Browser to import and organize assets
Place actors in a level and adjust transforms (location, rotation, scale)
Understand the difference between the World Outliner and Details panel

resources.title: Unreal Engine 5 Beginner Tutorial - UE5 Starter Course
resources.description: Comprehensive beginner course covering Blueprints, materials, lighting, and level design. A full 5-hour guided project that builds a complete game environment.
keyTakeaways: Create and connect Blueprint nodes for gameplay logic
Build basic materials with texture samples and parameters
Set up directional, point, and spot lights for a scene
Combine all skills to build a playable game level from scratch

resources.title: Building Open Worlds in Unreal Engine 5
resources.description: Deep dive into building large open worlds using World Partition, landscape tools, and data layers. Covers streaming, HLOD, and performance strategies for massive maps.
keyTakeaways: Enable and configure World Partition for automatic level streaming
Use the Landscape tool to sculpt terrain with layers and materials
Set up Data Layers to organize streaming content by gameplay region
Optimize open world performance with HLOD and distance culling

resources.title: Nanite | Inside Unreal
resources.description: Official Inside Unreal episode covering Nanite virtualized geometry — how it works, when to use it, performance characteristics, and integration with other systems like Lumen.
keyTakeaways: Understand how Nanite eliminates traditional LOD workflows
Enable Nanite on Static Meshes via the mesh editor settings
Know which geometry types support Nanite (and which don't — skeletal, translucent)
Profile Nanite performance using stat Nanite and GPU visualizations

resources.title: Lumen | Inside Unreal
resources.description: Official Inside Unreal episode on Lumen — UE5's dynamic global illumination and reflection system. Covers setup, performance tuning, and visual quality settings.
keyTakeaways: Understand Lumen's software ray tracing vs hardware ray tracing modes
Configure Lumen GI quality through Post Process Volume settings
Set up Lumen reflections using reflection capture actors as fallbacks
Tune performance by adjusting Lumen Scene Detail and Final Gather Quality

resources.title: Introduction to Blueprints | Live Training | Unreal Engine
resources.description: Official live training covering Blueprint fundamentals — variables, functions, events, flow control, and building a small interactive prototype from scratch.
keyTakeaways: Understand the Blueprint event graph, functions, and macros
Create variables and use Get/Set nodes for state management
Wire up input events and gameplay triggers with Blueprint logic
Debug Blueprints using breakpoints and the watch window

resources.title: Introduction to Materials | Live Training | Unreal Engine
resources.description: Official training on UE5 Material Editor — PBR workflow, texture sampling, material parameters, instances, and building common material types (metal, glass, fabric).
keyTakeaways: Understand PBR material inputs: Base Color, Metallic, Roughness, Normal
Create Material Instances for efficient parameter tweaking without recompiling
Use Texture Sample nodes and coordinate manipulation for tiling/UV effects
Build dynamic materials with Material Parameter Collections for runtime changes

resources.title: Networking & Multiplayer | Inside Unreal
resources.description: Official Inside Unreal episode on UE5 networking — server-client model, replication, RPCs, relevancy, and testing multiplayer locally with multiple sessions.
keyTakeaways: Understand UE5's authoritative server model and client prediction
Mark variables as Replicated with DOREPLIFETIME for state sync
Implement Server, Client, and Multicast RPCs for remote function calls
Test multiplayer locally using the Play-In-Editor net mode settings

resources.title: Gameplay Mechanics with Blueprints | Live Training | Unreal Engine
resources.description: Official live training on building gameplay mechanics — doors, switches, pickups, health systems, and spawning with Blueprint. Complete hands-on project.
keyTakeaways: Build interactive doors and switches with overlap triggers
Create pickup items with Blueprint interfaces for modularity
Implement a basic health and damage system using variables and events
Spawn actors at runtime and control their lifecycle

resources.title: Smart Ant: Building AI Behavior with State Tree and Smart Objects | Unreal Fest Bali 2025
resources.description: Unreal Fest Bali 2025 talk on building AI behavior using State Trees and Smart Objects. Covers practical AI decision-making, environment interaction, and modular behavior design.
keyTakeaways: Build AI behavior trees using UE5's State Tree system
Implement Smart Objects for environment-aware AI interactions
Design modular, reusable AI behavior patterns
Debug and iterate on AI decisions in real-time
